procedural_fairness: Judicial review assessed whether the PRRA officer's decision was reasonable based on new evidence presented post-rejection.
evidence_provided: most evidence was deemed repetitive or insufficiently personalized to prove individual risk beyond general conditions in Bangladesh
reasonableness_standard: The PRRA officer's decision was reasonable as the new evidence did not substantiate a significant change in circumstances or personal risk
risk_characterization: Is the applicant at risk of extortion and persecution if returned to Bangladesh
nexus_to_convention_grounds: warranting protection under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act

legal_basis: Section 113 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
standard_of_proof: sufficient new evidence to warrant protection

Different Crime.Crime Name: Impunity for Extrajudicial Killings (Border document misrepresentation)
legal_basis: section 113 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
new_evidence_impact: Three letters offered no materially new evidence
judicial_review_process: Court dismissed the judicial review, upholding the PRRA officer's decision
persecution_grounds: Applicant feared persecution in Bangladesh due to a documentary exposing RAB officers' wrongdoings
